cards.name: Alabaster Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
If Alabaster Dragon is put into your discard pile from play, shuffle Alabaster Dragon back into your deck.

cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Militia to tap.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)

cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Blessed Reversal
cards.text:
Play Blessed Reversal only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
For each attacking creature, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Blinding Light
cards.text: Tap all creatures except for white creatures. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Take any one summon creature from your discard pile and put that card into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand.

cards.name: Charging Paladin
cards.text: If Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Defiant Stand
cards.text:
Play Defiant Stand only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Any one creature gets +1/+3 until the end of the turn. If that creature is tapped, untap it.

cards.name: False Peace
cards.text: Choose any one player. That player can't attack on his or her next turn.

cards.name: Fleet-Footed Monk
cards.text: Fleet-Footed Monk can't be intercepted by any creature with offense 2 or greater.

cards.name: Gift of Estates
cards.text: If your opponent has more lands in play than you do, search your deck for up to three plains and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

cards.name: Harsh Justice
cards.text:
Play Harsh Justice only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, each attacking creature that damages you also deals equal damage to the attacking player.

cards.name: Keen-Eyed Archers
cards.text: Keen-Eyed Archers can intercept as though it had flying.

cards.name: Path of Peace
cards.text: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.

cards.name: Renewing Dawn
cards.text: For each mountain your opponent has in play, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Sacred Knight
cards.text: Sacred Knight can't be intercepted by black or red creatures.

cards.name: Sacred Nectar
cards.text: You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Seasoned Marshal
cards.text: If Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may choose to tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't intercept.)

cards.name: Spiritual Guardian
cards.text: When Spiritual Guardian comes into play from your hand, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Spotted Griffin
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Starlight
cards.text: For each black creature your opponent has in play, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Starlit Angel
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Steadfastness
cards.text: All your creatures get +0/+3 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Stern Marshal
cards.text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Stern Marshal to give any one creature +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Temporary Truce
cards.text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two any player draws, that player gains 2 life. (You choose whether to draw first.)

cards.name: Valorous Charge
cards.text: All white creatures get +2/+0 until the end of the turn. (This includes other players' white creatures.)

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk comes into play from your hand, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy any one tapped creature.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Flying
Wall of Swords can't attack.

cards.name: Warrior's Charge
cards.text: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Warrior's Charge
cards.text: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn. (For example, a 1/2 creature would become 2/3.)

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Put all creatures into their owners' discard piles. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Ancestral Memories
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your deck. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your discard pile.

cards.name: Balance of Power
cards.text: If you have fewer cards in your hand than your opponent does, draw until you have the same number. (When you play Balance of Power, it doesn't count as in your hand.)

cards.name: Baleful Stare
cards.text: Look at your opponent's hand. For each mountain and red card there, you draw a card. (You draw from your deck.)

cards.name: Capricious Sorcerer
cards.text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Capricious Sorcerer to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Cloak of Feathers
cards.text: Any one creature gains flying until the end of the turn. You draw a card.

cards.name: Cloud Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can intercept only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloud Pirates
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Pirates can intercept only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloud Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can intercept only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Command of Unsummoning
cards.text:
Play Command of Unsummoning only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Return any one or two attacking creatures to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Cruel Fate
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your opponent's deck. Put one of them into your opponent's discard pile and the rest on top of his or her deck in any order.

cards.name: Deep-Sea Serpent
cards.text: Deep-Sea Serpent can attack only if the defending player has an island in play.

cards.name: Djinn of the Lamp
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Déjà Vu
cards.text: Return any one sorcery card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping his or her creatures and lands.

cards.name: Flux
cards.text: Each player chooses and discards from his or her hand any number of cards and then draws that many cards. You then draw a card. (You choose first.)

cards.name: Ingenious Thief
cards.text:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief comes into play from your hand, look at your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War comes into play from your hand, return any one creature to its owner's hand. (If you're the only one with creatures, return one of them to your hand.)

cards.name: Mystic Denial
cards.text: Play Mystic Denial only in response to another player playing a summon creature or a sorcery. That card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her discard pile.

cards.name: Omen
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your deck and return them in any order. You may choose to shuffle your deck. Then draw a card.

cards.name: Owl Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar comes into play from your hand, draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Personal Tutor
cards.text: Search your deck for a sorcery and reveal that card to all players. Shuffle your deck and put the revealed card on top of it.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be intercepted.

cards.name: Prosperity
cards.text: Each player draws X cards.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Sorcerous Sight
cards.text: Look at your opponent's hand. You draw a card. (Draw the card from your deck.)

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Symbol of Unsummoning
cards.text: Return any one creature to its owner's hand. You draw a card.

cards.name: Taunt
cards.text: Choose any one player. On that player's next turn, all his or her creatures that can attack you must do so.

cards.name: Theft of Dreams
cards.text: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.

cards.name: Thing from the Deep
cards.text: If Thing from the Deep attacks, destroy one of your islands or destroy Thing from the Deep.

cards.name: Tidal Surge
cards.text: Tap any one, two, or three creatures without flying. (Tapped creatures can't intercept.)

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Return any one creature to the top of its owner's deck.

cards.name: Touch of Brilliance
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Withering Gaze
cards.text: Look at your opponent's hand. For each forest and green card there, you draw a card. (You draw from your deck.)

cards.name: Arrogant Vampire
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Assassin's Blade
cards.text:
Play Assassin's Blade only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Destroy any one attacking creature that isn't black.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Bog Raiders
cards.text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Bog Raiders can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Bog Wraith can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Charging Bandits
cards.text: If Charging Bandits attacks, it gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Craven Knight
cards.text: Craven Knight can't intercept.

cards.name: Cruel Bargain
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up. (For example, if you have 11 life, you lose 6 life.)

cards.name: Cruel Tutor
cards.text: Search your deck for any card. Shuffle your deck and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Dread Charge
cards.text: This turn, your black creatures can be intercepted only by other black creatures.

cards.name: Dread Reaper
cards.text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper comes into play from your hand, you lose 5 life. (The person who plays Dread Reaper loses the life.)

cards.name: Dry Spell
cards.text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)

cards.name: Ebon Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon comes into play from your hand, you may force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Endless Cockroaches
cards.text: If Endless Cockroaches is put into your discard pile from play, return Endless Cockroaches to your hand.

cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Final Strike
cards.text: Choose one of your creatures. Final Strike deals to your opponent damage equal to that creature's offense. Then, put the creature in your discard pile.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger comes into play from your hand, you may choose to return a summon creature from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text:
Destroy any one creature that isn't black. (A creature is black if it has o
B in its cost.)

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text: Destroy any one creature that isn't black.

cards.name: Howling Fury
cards.text: Any one creature gets +4/+0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: King's Assassin
cards.text: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap King's Assassin to destroy any one tapped creature.

cards.name: Mercenary Knight
cards.text: When Mercenary Knight comes into play from your hand, choose and discard a summon creature from your hand or destroy Mercenary Knight.

cards.name: Mind Knives
cards.text: Your opponent discards a card at random from his or her hand.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Your opponent chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)

cards.name: Nature's Ruin
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures. (This includes your green creatures.)

cards.name: Noxious Toad
cards.text: If Noxious Toad is put into your discard pile from play, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Rain of Tears
cards.text: Destroy any one land.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return any one summon creature from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Serpent Assassin
cards.text: When Serpent Assassin comes into play from your hand, you may choose to destroy any one creature that isn't black.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior comes into play from your hand, you lose 3 life. (The person who plays Serpent Warrior loses the life.)

cards.name: Soul Shred
cards.text: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Undying Beast
cards.text: If Undying Beast is put into your discard pile from play, put Undying Beast on top of your deck.

cards.name: Vampiric Feast
cards.text: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to any one creature or player. You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Vampiric Touch
cards.text: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to your opponent. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Virtue's Ruin
cards.text: Destroy all white creatures. (This includes your white creatures.)

cards.name: Wicked Pact
cards.text: Destroy any two creatures that aren't black. You lose 5 life. (You can't play Wicked Pact unless you can choose two creatures to destroy.)

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player. (For example, if you tap a mountain plus four other lands when you play Blaze, it deals 4 damage.)

cards.name: Boiling Seas
cards.text: Destroy all islands. (This includes your islands.)

cards.name: Burning Cloak
cards.text:
Any one creature gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
Burning Cloak deals 2 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Craven Giant
cards.text: Craven Giant can't intercept.

cards.name: Desert Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Devastation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures and lands. (This includes your creatures and lands.)

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without flying. (This includes you and your creatures without flying.)

cards.name: Fire Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Fire Dragon comes into play from your hand, it deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play.

cards.name: Fire Imp
cards.text: When Fire Imp comes into play from your hand, it deals 2 damage to any one creature. (If you're the only player with creatures, Fire Imp deals 2 damage to one of your creatures.)

cards.name: Fire Snake
cards.text: If Fire Snake is put into your discard pile from play, destroy any one land.

cards.name: Fire Tempest
cards.text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you. If all players drop to 0 life or less, the game is a draw.)

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all plains. (This includes your plains.)

cards.name: Forked Lightning
cards.text: Forked Lightning deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any one, two, or three creatures.

cards.name: Hulking Cyclops
cards.text: Hulking Cyclops can't intercept.

cards.name: Hulking Goblin
cards.text: Hulking Goblin can't intercept.

cards.name: Last Chance
cards.text: Take another turn after this one. You lose the game at the end of that turn. (You don't lose if you've already won.)

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to your opponent.

cards.name: Lava Flow
cards.text: Destroy any one creature or land.

cards.name: Mountain Goat
cards.text: Mountainwalk (If defending player has any mountains in play, Mountain Goat can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Pillaging Horde
cards.text: When Pillaging Horde comes into play from your hand, discard a card at random from your hand or destroy Pillaging Horde.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Raging Cougar
cards.text: Raging Cougar is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness. (It can attack the turn you play it, unless another card prevents this.)

cards.name: Raging Minotaur
cards.text: Raging Minotaur is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Rain of Salt
cards.text: Destroy any two lands.

cards.name: Scorching Spear
cards.text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Scorching Winds
cards.text:
Play Scorching Winds only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Scorching Winds deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountains.)

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy any one land.

cards.name: Thundermare
cards.text:
Thundermare is unaffected by summoning sickness.
When Thundermare comes into play from your hand, tap all other creatures. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Volcanic Dragon is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Wall of Granite
cards.text: Wall of Granite can't attack.

cards.name: Winds of Change
cards.text: Each player counts the cards in his or her hand, shuffles those cards into his or her deck, and then draws that many cards. (When you play Winds of Change, it doesn't count as a card in your hand.)

cards.name: Alluring Scent
cards.text: Choose any one creature. This turn, all creatures able to intercept that creature do so.

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Anaconda can't be intercepted.)

cards.text: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Anaconda can't be intercepted. Swamps are in play regardless of whether they're tapped or untapped.)

cards.text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any one creature or player.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk (If defending player has any islands in play, Bull Hippo can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Charging Rhino
cards.text: Charging Rhino can't be intercepted by more than one creature.

cards.name: Deep Wood
cards.text:
Play Deep Wood only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.

cards.text: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Elite Cat Warrior can't be intercepted.)

cards.name: Elite Cat Warrior
cards.text: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Elite Cat Warrior can't be intercepted. Forests are in play regardless of whether they're tapped or untapped.)

cards.name: Elven Cache
cards.text: Return any one card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Fruition
cards.text: For each forest you and your opponent have in play, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Giant Spider can intercept as though it had flying.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each player and each creature with flying. (This includes you and your creatures with flying.)

cards.text: Jungle Lion can't intercept.

cards.text: Untap all your creatures.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn. (For example, a 6/3 creature would become 10/7.)

cards.name: Moon Sprite
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Natural Order
cards.text: Search your deck for a green summon creature and put that card into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand. Then put one of your green creatures into your discard pile. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: You gain 8 life.

cards.name: Nature's Cloak
cards.text: All your green creatures gain forestwalk until the end of the turn. (If defending player has any forests in play, none of your green creatures can be intercepted.)

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your deck for a forest and put that card into play. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

cards.name: Needle Storm
cards.text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying. (This includes your creatures with flying.)

cards.text: When Plant Elemental comes into play from your hand, destroy one of your forests or destroy Plant Elemental.

cards.name: Primeval Force
cards.text: When Primeval Force comes into play from your hand, destroy three of your forests or destroy Primeval Force.

cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be intercepted by more than one creature.

cards.name: Summer Bloom

cards.text: Search your deck for a summon creature and reveal that card to all players. Then shuffle your deck and put the revealed card on top of it.

cards.name: Thundering Wurm
cards.text: When Thundering Wurm comes into play from your hand, discard a land from your hand or destroy Thundering Wurm.

cards.text:
Play Treetop Defense only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, all your creatures can intercept as though they had flying.
